data.Title: Google AI Overviews Now Less Frequent, Research Shows
data.Description: Research by @SERanking comparing pre and post-rollout results of AI Overviews on 100K keywords shows only 8.71% of keywords have AI Overviews vs 64% before release. Longer queries tend to trigger AIOs more.

data.Title: Google Search Showing Fewer Reddit and Quora Links
data.Description: Observation that Google Search appears to be displaying fewer links from Reddit and Quora in its search results, potentially indicating an algorithmic shift.

data.Title: Google Explains When a Spike in Crawling Is Bad
data.Description: Google's Gary Illyes explains that sudden spikes in crawling activity from Googlebot may indicate potential issues with a website, such as being hacked.

data.Title: Google Testing "People Also Ask" With 6 Default Questions
data.Description: Google is testing a change to its search results page where the "People also ask" section defaults to showing 6 questions instead of 4.

data.Title: Google Adds Menu Button to Some Local Panels in Search
data.Description: Google is adding a menu button to some local panels in search results, potentially improving user experience and providing more options for interacting with local business information.

data.Title: Google AdSense Rolls Out New Privacy Features for US State Regulations
data.Description: Google AdSense is introducing a new feature to help publishers comply with privacy regulations in various US states.

data.Title: Technical SEO Skills Can Boost Salaries by up to $35k
data.Description: Highlights the earning potential of SEO professionals with specific skill sets, such as technical SEO and analytics, which are in high demand.

data.Title: Google Search Console Reports: Pound Signs (#) Not Related to Canonicalization
data.Description: Google's John Mueller clarifies that the pound signs (#) appearing in Google Search Console reports are not related to canonicalization, but instead to Google's tracking of on-page sitelinks.

data.Title: Google Maps Adds New "Edit" and "Post" Buttons for Business Profiles
data.Description: Google Maps is adding new "edit" and "post" buttons to the interface for managing Google Business Profile listings, making it easier for businesses to update their information.

data.Title: Google Search Results Don't Always Show Original Source, Says Mueller
data.Description: Google's John Mueller stated that the search results displayed by Google do not always reflect the original source of the content, as determined by Google's algorithms.

data.Title: Bing Webmaster Tools Can Show CTR Higher Than 100%
data.Description: Bing Webmaster Tools has the capability to display a click-through rate (CTR) exceeding 100% if a user clicks multiple times on the same search result within a session.

data.Title: Google Testing Black Sitelinks in Search Results
data.Description: Google is currently experimenting with a new visual design for sitelinks in its search results, where the sitelinks are displayed in a black color.

data.Title: Leaked Google Documents Suggest Keyword Density Still Matters in SEO
data.Description: "Keyword stuffing" is a discarded optimization tactic. Leaked Google documents suggest otherwise.

data.Title: TikTok Ads to Feature AI Avatars of Creators and Stock Actors
data.Description: TikTok is introducing AI-generated avatars for use in advertisements, allowing brands to feature virtual representations of creators and stock actors in their campaigns.

data.Title: YouTube Begins Testing "Notes" Feature for Videos
data.Description: YouTube is rolling out a new feature called "Notes," allowing creators to add text-based annotations to their videos, enhancing viewer engagement and providing additional context.

data.Title: Runway Unveils Gen-3 Alpha: AI Model Generates Realistic 10-Second Video Clips
data.Description: Runway has released Gen-3 Alpha, an AI model capable of generating high-quality, realistic video clips up to 10 seconds in length, advancing the capabilities of text-to-video technology.

data.Title: Google Chrome for Android Testing "Listen to This Page" Feature
data.Description: Google is testing a new feature for its Chrome browser on Android devices that enables users to listen to text-heavy web pages, providing a convenient alternative to reading.

data.Title: Gaming Innovation Group Acquires SEO Specialist Titan for €3.2 Million
data.Description: Gaming Innovation Group (GiG) has acquired Titan, a company specializing in SEO and content services, for a total consideration of €3.2 million.

data.Title: Google's Gary Illyes Offers Unconventional Advice on Fixing Broken Backlinks
data.Description: Google's Gary Illyes has provided an unexpected response to a question about addressing broken backlinks, suggesting an alternative approach to resolving the issue.
